snippet: Judges sparred with lawyers about how such bans affected the children of same-sex parents and whether preventing gay couples from marrying actually strengthened heterosexual unions.
abstract: Federal Court of Appeals for 10th Circuit appears divided about whether socially conservative state of Utah can ban same-sex marriage; judges spar with lawyers about how such bans affect children of same-sex parents and whether preventing gay couples from marrying actually strengthens heterosexual unions.

byline.contributor: Steven Yaccino contributed reporting from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: Judges sparred with lawyers about how such bans affected the children of same-sex parents and whether preventing gay couples from marrying actually strengthened heterosexual unions.

headline.main: U.S. Court Seems Split on Utah Gay Marriage Ban
headline.print_headline: U.S. Court Seems Split on Utah Marriage Ban

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
